column4: X on Ubuntu 7.04 LiveCD looks like it doesn't find the resolution of my monitor on a laptop. The resolution should be 1280x800 but in /etc/X11/xorg.conf the resolution is 1024x786 but I can't see a thing on the screen! The screen is turned off when I'm on console 7, on console 1 I see the terminal. Help!
sounds like the x-server isn't starting. which driver are you using according to xorg.conf?
but if X isn't starting shouldn't I see a terminal at console 7 ?

mm, as far as i know, the ati driver looks at xorg.conf to find out what it should be doing. you could try manually editing xorg.conf to include the graphics modes of your monitor and then restarting the x-server
did you check the default depth? what happens if you change the driver from "ati" to "vesa"? does x-windows start?
it's just that the whole screen is streched and fuzzy... shouldn't it be sharp and crisp?
I can't switch to resolution 1280x800... it always displays at 1024x786
can I use another driver... that supports higher resolutions ?
sorry. my flatmate needed some help. i'm back now. a further possibility is that the refresh rates in xorg.conf aren't high enough
from what I saw in windows, the screen's max refresh rate is 60Hz but in System > Pref. > Screen Resolution it says 61Hz which is impossible
there's also the possibility that the gnome window manager is limiting your resolution. have a look here:
